image.altText: A man holds an umbrella with his back to the camera, overlooking a beach with a city in the background.

props.synopsis: It's muggy, you've got a week off work, and you're desperate to make the most of it with plenty of ocean swims. If it bucketed down yesterday, can you still go in?

title.children: The dangers of swimming in oceans, rivers or waterholes after rain

image.altText: Fallen trees and powelines.

props.synopsis: A woman has been killed after severe storms ripped through parts of south-east Queensland last night, bringing intense rain, large hail and fierce winds.

title.children: Woman killed, theme parks closed as wild storms lash the Gold Coast on Christmas Day

image.altText: Australia batters Steve Smith and Usman Khawaja run between the wickets. Pakistan bowler Khurram Shahzad stands between them.

props.synopsis: One of the highlights of the cricket calendar is here, with Australia taking on touring Pakistan in the second Test at the MCG on Boxing Day. Follow live.

title.children: Boxing Day Test kicks off at MCG against Pakistan

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia is sent in to bat

image.altText: Yacht racing with Sydney Harbour Bridge in background.

props.synopsis: Where is the start line? Do crew members get any sleep during the race? What prizes are they racing for? What do you mean the first over the finish line is not considered the top prize? Wait, what ... there's a boat called Imalizard?

title.children: How to watch the Sydney to Hobart yacht race — and what to look for

image.altText: Silhouettes of people dancing in a nightclub bathed in red light.

props.synopsis: This was the year we got shock and more. While 2023 saw continued freedom from COVID lockdowns and rules, a cost-of-living crisis and an ever-growing crunch in housing put substantial curbs on our lives and choices.

title.children: Stocks boomed, house prices bubbled, people kept their jobs — and yet things still kept getting harder

image.altText: A man playing ice hockey

props.synopsis: When Adam Johnson died during an ice hockey match earlier this year, his club called it a "freak accident". Now police are investigating whether another player could have been criminally responsible.

title.children: A player's brutal death on the ice hockey rink has left a UK team devastated and police in tricky territory

image.altText: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny is seen on a screen via video link from a penal colony.

props.synopsis: Mr Navalny was tracked down after supporters lost touch with him for more than two weeks.

title.children: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny moved to prison in the Arctic

image.altText: swimmer with cap and goggles

props.synopsis: Hollywood's horror shark still looms large in many minds around the ocean. Yet drones show people and sharks frequently and peacefully mingle, writes ABC presenter and keen ocean swimmer Sinéad Mangan.

title.children: Me, the sea and the 'Jaws effect'. Just how likely am I to be bitten by a shark?

image.altText: Kate Nicol holds a wrapped Christmas gift at her home in outer suburban Melbourne

props.synopsis: A single mum in Melbourne's outer suburbs says a no interest loan helped her get on top of her money stress, with financial experts describing them as a safe credit option for those struggling during the festive season.

title.children: Kate was worried about the cost of living this Christmas. Financial services say they're experiencing different requests for help

image.altText: Grenfell was covered in what looked like snow after a hail storm on Christmas Day.

props.synopsis: A giant hail storm hit the Central West of New South Wales blanketing the area in what looks like white snow on Christmas Day, as the weather bureau issues a warning for large parts of interior eastern Australia.

title.children: Inland NSW hail leaves residents with white Christmas as BOM issues weather warnings

image.altText: Dee Wilde standing in the playground at Blaxland Preschool with children behind her, New South Wales, December 2023.

props.synopsis: Experts say the times when children were sheltered from conversations about emergencies and disasters are over, and a newly developed toolkit will help have age-appropriate conversations as the emergency season looms.

title.children: Fires, floods and viruses: Helping kids deal with disasters as emergency season looms

image.altText: People waiting in line outside Grill'd Perth CBD.

props.synopsis: Something as simple as a hot meal often becomes a luxury when you are sleeping rough. But for one night a month, those doing it tough are being invited to enjoy a burger on the house.

title.children: 'You get to see them smile': Free burger initiative for rough sleepers offers more than just a hot meal

image.altText: A woman standing on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: The Cowan resident, who vividly remembers the collision that killed a young motorcycle rider and left her with a fractured spine, is among locals calling for a change in attitude on the roads this summer.

title.children: Hawkesbury River crash survivor among those calling for action to improve safety on Old Pacific Highway

image.altText: A tall man and a woman walking along a dusty road

props.synopsis: From dusty farming communities to sleepy seaside towns, crime fiction set in regional Australia is taking off. Here's why readers are devouring these stories.

title.children: 'A narrow world': Why a small country town is the perfect setting for crime fiction

image.altText: Britain's King Charles III poses for a photo, during the recording of his Christmas message.

props.synopsis: King Charles calls on people to help those less fortunate during a time of economic hardship and global conflict in his Christmas Day message.

title.children: King Charles urges compassion, care for environment in time of conflict

image.altText: A young girl wearing a spacesuit costume and helmet standing in front of a pink and blue Ferris wheel

props.synopsis: Andrew Rovenko's otherworldly photographs of his daughter wearing an astronaut costume attracted fans from all over the world — and now feature in a coffee-table book.

title.children: Tired of baking sourdough, this Melbourne family began an unusual lockdown project — that went viral

image.altText: A little girl and her family wearing puffy coats jumps in the air outside a large christmas tree in front of a church

props.synopsis: A cold wave envelops northern and central swathes of China, bringing snow storms and record-breaking temperatures.

title.children: Beijing records longest period of sub-freezing temperatures in 72 years

image.altText: A close up of four children in black and white.

props.synopsis: On Christmas Day in 1945, a fire consumed the home of George and Jennie Sodder, leaving five of the couple's 10 children presumed dead. But questions arose in the aftermath, placing the Sodder children at the centre of one of American history's most infamous unsolved cases.

title.children: The Sodders thought they lost their children in a house fire. But they found only mystery in the ashes

image.altText: Boccia player Jessi Hooper is sitting in her wheelchair, and throws a boccia ball underarm.

props.synopsis: Jessi Hooper goes without food and other necessities to ensure she can play the little-known sport of boccia, which has changed her life.

title.children: How a little-known sport changed Jessi's life when she was diagnosed with a neurological disorder

image.altText: The Royal Exchange Hotel gaming room sign

props.synopsis: The ABC ventures out in the hours after midnight on a Tuesday morning to the pub gaming rooms that are open all night, every night. Gambling researchers say it's when gambling harm is at its greatest.

title.children: Why are so many pub gaming rooms in Brisbane open long after the bars have closed?

image.altText: Man sits on floor help person with shirt off

props.synopsis: The proposed plan would include an initial two-week ceasefire, a phased hostage release, and the creation of a Palestinian government of experts controlling Gaza and the occupied West Bank.

title.children: Egypt proposes an ambitious post Israel-Gaza war plan as the Pope uses his Christmas message to condemn the 'appalling harvest' of civilians

image.altText: A close up shot of a reindeer's face and eyes, with a red harness around its nose

props.synopsis: Researchers are working to understand why reindeer can see light in the ultraviolet spectrum and if the underlying mechanism can have any benefits for humans.

title.children: Reindeer are famous for pulling Santa's sleigh, but it's their vision that has scientists interested

image.altText: a child sitting on santa's lap

props.synopsis: Christmas spirit has a whole new meaning to Cairns residents, who after a week of enduring devastation, have started to smile again.

title.children: Homes, cars lost but 'the love is here' for Christmas Day, says Cairns flood victim

image.altText: a nativity display at St Andrew’s Ukrainian Catholic church in Lidcombe

props.synopsis: Christmas is different again this year for the many thousands of Ukrainian refugees in Australia, after a change in the date to "turn away from Russian orthodoxy", and a second year away from loved ones.

title.children: Ukrainian refugees away from home for second Christmas as celebrations move to December 25

image.altText: Flooding in Pagewood

props.synopsis: The SES has heard reports of 30 townhouses being inundated by flash flooding in Pagewood, as flights have been diverted interstate.

title.children: 20 flights delayed at Sydney Airport as flash flooding sweeps through city

image.altText: A man holds a female child

props.synopsis: Families in flooded Far North Queensland are getting ready to celebrate the festive season today. The tourism industry is hoping for a Christmas miracle.

title.children: John's home is a mess from the Cairns flood but he won't let it ruin Christmas for daughter Alexa

image.altText: Four women decked in red swimsuits with santa hats posing for photo on the beach

props.synopsis: From one family's unexpected gift to communal lunches and prayers to beach celebrations, here's how Australians have celebrated Christmas Day.

title.children: Christmas Day celebrations across Australia see new and old traditions embraced

image.altText: The interior of a sandstone church, with high sculptural windows of stained glass

props.synopsis: This Christmas morning, Rev David Pileggi will rise early in the old city of Jerusalem, don his clerical garb and walk next door to officiate at Christmas services, sharing a message of defiant hopefulness.

title.children: Holy Night in the Holy City surrounded by death

image.altText: CCUTENDTRMIBETAELIDSAW these are the red tin letters that need solving.

props.synopsis: For more than a decade, the Tweed Regional Museum in northern New South Wales tried to solve a red-letter anagram. Here's how they finally cracked it.

title.children: Jumbled red-letter riddle takes 13 years to solve
